>So said Paul Zabelin on 2003-05-28 --------------------
>For our group con=
sideration, I created one example of 
>ExceptionTestCase usage to test some=
 exceptions of Vector class:
>
>http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/files/s=
rc/VectorExceptionTest.java
>
>This is the way I have been using ExceptionT=
estCase in past projects 
>and I am interested to learn if it is valid in y=
our opinion.
>
>Do you think this example will be useful to include with ju=
nit 
>samples?

Perhaps, but this technique makes it difficult to see which=
 code blocks should throw which exceptions. I have to bounce back and forth=
 between the test and the suite() method to determine which exceptions I sh=
ould expect the code to throw. That's distracting.

The assertThrows patter=
n makes that clearer, even if it results in more code.
